sentences.en: 18% of the women we polled said their husbands had a drinking problem.
sentences.cn: 我们调查的妇女当中有18%的人说丈夫有酗酒问题。

sentences.en: A MORI poll showed that 68% of people opposed the ban.
sentences.cn: 摩利公司的民意测验显示，有68%的人反对这一禁令。

sentences.en: A national poll shows the presidential race in a dead heat.
sentences.cn: 一项全国民意调查显示总统竞选相持不下。

sentences.en: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.cn: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.en: A regressive tax, like the poll tax, takes proportionately more of a poor person's income.
sentences.cn: 像人头税一样, 递减税占穷人收入的比例更大.

sentences.en: A straw poll conducted at the end of the meeting found most people agreed with Mr Forth.
sentences.cn: 会议结束时所做的非正式民意测验表明大多数人赞同福思先生。

sentences.en: He came third in the poll with 149 votes.
sentences.cn: 他在选举中获得149票，名列第三。

sentences.en: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.cn: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.en: Labour polled just 4% of the vote.
sentences.cn: 工党只得到4%的选票。

sentences.en: Ministers believed it was vital to dump the poll tax before the election.
sentences.cn: 大臣们认为在大选前停止征收人头税至关重要。

sentences.en: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.cn: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.en: Smith changed his name by deed poll to Jervis-Smith.
sentences.cn: 史密斯通过单边契据将自己的名字更改为杰维斯&dash1;史密斯。

sentences.en: Ten million voters went to the polls.
sentences.cn: 1,000 万选民参加了投票。

sentences.en: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.cn: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

sentences.en: The poll canvassed the views of almost eighty economists.
sentences.cn: 民意调查征询了将近80位经济学家的意见。

sentences.en: The poll has a margin of error of plus or minus 5 per cent.
sentences.cn: 民意测验有上下5%的误差率。

sentences.en: The poll suggests that the strongest unsatisfied appetite for home computers isn't among the richest consumers.
sentences.cn: 民意调查显示，家用电脑的最大需求者不是那些最有钱的人。

sentences.en: The poll was widely discredited after allegations of ballot rigging.
sentences.cn: 选举舞弊的指控出现后，这次投票测验受到了广泛质疑。

sentences.en: The result of the poll won't be known until midnight.
sentences.cn: 选举结果要到午夜才能揭晓.

sentences.en: The results of the poll dealt a humiliating rebuff to Mr Jones.
sentences.cn: 民意调查的结果对琼斯先生很不利，让他颜面尽失。

sentences.en: They expected a heavy poll.
sentences.cn: 他们期望会有很高的投票数.

sentences.en: We already have files on people's tax details, mortgages and poll tax.
sentences.cn: 我们已经建立了人们纳税详情、抵押贷款以及人头税的档案。

words.tran_cn: 精明的；有策略的；狡猾的；审慎的
无角的；剪过毛的；修过枝的
投票；民意测验；投票数；投票所
投票；剪短；对…进行民意测验；获得选票

trans.tran_cn: 无角的；剪过毛的；修过枝的
民意调查，投票选举，投票数
trans.tran_en: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

trans.tran_cn: 得到（一定数目的）选票，对…进行民意调查
trans.tran_en: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

trans.tran_cn: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
trans.tran_en: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject
